general_summary: Good effort overall, but instability due to excessive ankle acceleration indicates compromised spinal alignment. Focus on control and maintaining neutral alignment for safety.

remedial_plan.name: Wall Sits with Spinal Alignment Focus
remedial_plan.target_fault: Excessive ankle acceleration causing spinal compromise
remedial_plan.adaptive_reasoning: Builds lower body stability while reinforcing neutral spine position - critical for beginners learning to prioritize alignment over depth.

timeline_events.detailed_explanation: Ankle acceleration reached 0.54 m/s² (19281% over target) indicates instability that compromises spinal safety. Reduce movement speed to maintain control.
